# Arresting Procedures Should the Almayer get boarded by a hostile force no arrests should be made unless the person is a danger to the Almayer and or its personnel.
## Arresting a Suspect [italic]These arrests can be performed anywhere on the warship.[/italic] - Take down the Suspect if they resist and securely restrain them. - Move the Suspect to a brig cell. - Continue to [bold]charging procedure[/bold].
## Field Arrests [italic]These refer to arrests performed in the area of operations.[/italic] - Arrests are restricted to the FOB, dropships, and secure areas unless in pursuit. - If a suspect flees outside the above areas or are witnessed by the [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color], they may be pursuited. - If there are hostiles in the vicinity, the [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color] must abort the arrest and move to a secure area. - [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color]s may move between secure areas. - Squad Leaders may detain marines of their squad that violate the law, but must detain marines of their squad by orders of the [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color] or Command. - Marines detained by the Squad Leaders should be passed onto the [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color] when possible.
